channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Oil prices suffer November drop as Middle East fears ease, OPEC+ delays meeting
item.description: Oil futures fell Friday, booking weekly and monthly losses after a cease-fire this week between Israel and Iran-backed Hezbollah helped soothe remaini...

item.title: The Score: GM, Macy's, Novo Nordisk and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: My friend declared bankruptcy. Can creditors still go after him for child support, back taxes and student debt?
item.description: “Most of those old debts are credit-card debts.”

item.title: S&P 500, Dow Notch Records to Cap Best Month of the Year
item.description: U.S. stocks finished November with their biggest monthly gains this year, with chip stocks rallying Friday.

item.title: Stocks ride to best month in a year as ‘Red Sweep’ unleashes ‘animal spirits’
item.description: By almost any measure, November has been a blockbuster month for U.S. stocks.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Post Weekly, Monthly Gains
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures rose with colder temperature forecasts boosting the near-term demand outlook.

item.title: Invest in Banking Like Warren Buffett: Own a 'Castle'
item.description: Among Berkshire Hathaway’s largest holdings is a financial information-services company. The sector’s results speak for themselves.

item.title: Front Month Nymex Crude Fell 1.82% This Month to Settle at $68.00
item.description: Front Month Nymex Crude for January delivery settled 1.1% lower at $68 a barrel. In the month, the contract lost 1.8%.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yields falls to 5-week low as traders return after Thanksgiving
item.description: Bond yields fell Friday as the market re-opened following the Thanksgiving break.

item.title: ‘I’m young, debt-free and happy-go-lucky’: My boyfriend has $45,000 in debts, two houses, two kids and pays child support. Is he a safe bet to marry?
item.description: “Lately, we’ve been discussing the future, including marriage.”
